This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ASQUS.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-13T15:18:39Z Kaisa Puustinen 2015-02-13T15:04:24+00:00 2015-02-13T15:04:24+00:00 Qualitative and mixed methods sofware (CAQDAS) seminars https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;92eda8a8.1502 The National Centre for Research Methods (NCRM) is organising qualitative and mixed methods software (CAQDAS) seminars that may be of interest to the list subscribers. Please find below details of two upcoming seminars:<br><br>Mixed Methods Software Planning Seminar (CAQDAS)<br>Date and location: 11 March 2015, Hoddesdon, Hertfordshire<br>Presenter: Christina Silver (CAQDAS Networking Project)<br>Fees: This is a free event<br>Further info and registration: http://go.soton.ac.uk/671 [...] Ahuja, Devdeep 2015-01-23T10:51:15+00:00 2015-01-23T10:51:15+00:00 PRS Annual Conference - Deadline 24/01/2015 - Submit abstract NOW https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;c3cfe3b1.1501 Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>Dear all,<br><br>The annual conference of Physiotherapy Research Society promises to be a feast. Keynotes speakers include -<br><br>Prof. Sally Singh (Head and Professor of the Centre for Exercise and Rehabilitation Science, Respiratory Biomedical Research Unit, University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust and Visiting Professor of Loughborough University) - The Impact of Research upon Clinical Practice \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Implementations in Leicester [...] Philip Rose 2015-01-22T15:19:02+00:00 2015-01-22T15:19:02+00:00 Forthcoming research methods courses from the EPPI-Centre, UCL Institute of Education, University College London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;34eb7ee3.1501 Research methods courses from the EPPI-Centre (UCL Institute of Education) will provide you with highly sought-after skills and knowledge, supporting career development in those academic, policy or practice settings where systematic reviews are used and produced.<br><br>1. Systematic reviews for policy and practice \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd a short course in conducting and using reviews [...] Ahuja, Devdeep 2015-01-12T16:51:41+00:00 2015-01-12T16:51:41+00:00 Call for abstracts - Physiotherapy Research Society Annual Conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;ec4ce4e0.1501 Apologies for cross posting<br><br>prs.csp.org.uk/news/2014/11/17/call-papers-bridging-gaps-research-deadline-14-january-2015<br><br>The Physiotherapy Research Society (PRS) invites presentations of original ongoing or concluded research projects for oral or poster presentations. All health professions are strongly encouraged to submit their research if it is relevant for physiotherapists.<br><br>We welcome, but do not restrict to, research relating to the topic 'Bridging Gaps in Research', especially research projects spanning more than one area and/or profession, or linking research and practice. Another area of interest is the 'use of social media for advancing research'. Abstracts should should not exceed 350 words (plus up to two references), and must take the [...] University of Oxford CPD Centre 2015-01-12T15:48:05+00:00 2015-01-12T15:48:05+00:00 Three Evidence-Based Health Care Career Enhancement Scholarships worth \ufffd\ufffd1,970 each https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;a00e2290.1501 Evidence-Based Health Care Career Enhancement Scholarship \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd helping gifted individuals advance their skills in evidence-based health care and improve practice.<br>The Postgraduate Programme in Evidence-Based Health Care is offering a Career Enhancement Scholarship to one exceptional applicant per course as detailed below. The Scholarship will cover the full cost of tuition fees (\ufffd\ufffd1,970) but excludes the cost of travel, accommodation and subsistence. The student is expected to cover these costs. For further details on how to apply please follow the links below.<br>Clinical Trial Management, 27 April - 1 May 2015<br>Developing best practice for the management and delivery of [...] James Thomas 2015-01-09T08:28:29+00:00 2015-01-09T08:28:29+00:00 Re: Training course on mixed methods research and mixed studies reviews https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;74215083.1501 For those who might be interested:<br>Cochrane Switzerland is organising a course this June which may be of interest to you. The course is on mixed methods research and mixed studies reviews, see for detailed info: http://swiss.cochrane.org/sites/swiss.cochrane.org/files/uploads/Mixed%20methods%20research%202015.pdf. Philip Rose 2014-12-08T11:10:08+00:00 2014-12-08T11:10:08+00:00 Forthcoming research methods courses from the EPPI-Centre, UCL Institute of Education, University College London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;795482c9.1412 Forthcoming research methods courses from the EPPI-Centre, UCL Institute of Education, University College London<br><br>1. Research Engagement, Participation, and Impact<br>(previously called Participative Research and Policy)<br><br>Gain knowledge and skills to help maximise the impact of research in addressing issues of concern to the public, practitioners and policymakers. This online course runs for 15 weeks from 14 January 2015. The deadline for applications is 15 December 2014. [...] Andrew Booth 2014-12-01T16:23:00+00:00 2014-12-01T16:23:00+00:00 The Quality of Reporting Tool (QuaRT) Wiki https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;82005b86.1412 The QuaRT Wiki<br><br>Announcing the Quality of Reporting Tool (QuaRT) Wiki<br><br>This wiki has been compiled as a single "one-stop shop" for information<br>on the Quality of Reporting Tool (QuaRT) -a tool for quality assessment<br>of research studies for potential inclusion in a qualitative evidence<br>synthesis (qualitative systematic review) (Carroll et al, 2011). The<br>QuaRT Tool was developed byDr Christopher ("Chris") CarrollandDr Andrew<br>Booth at the School of Health & Related Research (ScHARR), University of<br>Sheffield.<br>http://quart.pbworks.com/ [...] Andrew Booth 2014-11-25T09:43:04+00:00 2014-11-25T09:43:04+00:00 Recent Methodological Papers in Qualitative Evidence Synthesis https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;b7bb2973.1411 BMC Med Res Methodol. <http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25407140#>2014<br>Nov 19;14(1):119. [Epub ahead of print]<br><br>A methodological systematic review of what's wrong with<br>meta-ethnography reporting.<br><br>France EF<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=France%20EF%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=25407140>,Ring<br>N<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=Ring%20N%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=25407140>,Thomas<br>R<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=Thomas%20R%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=25407140>,Noyes<br>J<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=Noyes%20J%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=25407140>,Maxwell<br>M<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=Maxwell%20M%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=25407140>,Jepson<br>R<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=Jepson%20R%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=25407140>.<br><br>Abstract<br><br>BACKGROUND:<br><br>Syntheses of qualitative studies can inform health policy, services and<br>our understanding of patient experience. Meta-ethnography is a<br>systematic seven-phase interpretive qualitative synthesis approach<br>well-suited to producing new theories and conceptual models. However,<br>there are concerns about the quality of meta-ethnography reporting,<br>particularly the analysis and synthesis processes. Our aim was to<br>investigate the application and reporting of methods in recent<br>meta-ethnography journal papers, [...] Philip Rose 2014-10-27T10:57:02+00:00 2014-10-27T10:57:02+00:00 Research methods courses from the EPPI-Centre, Institute of Education, University of London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;7b24438f.1410 Apologies for cross posting<br><br>Forthcoming research methods courses from the EPPI-Centre, Institute of Education, University of London<br><br>1. Participative Research and Policy: research use, relevance and impact<br><br>Learn in this online course about researchers, service users and others doing and using research together for better public services and civil society.<br><br>This course runs for 15 weeks from 14 January 2015. The deadline for applications is 8 December 2014. [...] Judy Wright 2014-09-10T11:14:08+01:00 2014-09-10T11:14:08+01:00 Mixed Methods Systematic Review Course, Leeds, 23-24 Oct 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;f73d79a7.1409 ** apologies for cross-posting**<br><br>Dear all,<br><br>I'm delighted to announce a 2-day mixed methods systematic review course will held in the University of Leeds on 23rd and 24th October 2014. It will be delivered by Professor James Thomas, Director of the Department of Health Reviews Facility EPPI-Centre, Institute of Education, University of London. [...] Philip Rose 2014-08-07T16:00:23+01:00 2014-08-07T16:00:23+01:00 Service and Programme Evaluation: A Practical Workshop for Managers and Commissioners https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;31ab47f7.1408 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;31ab47f7.1408">Service and Programme Evaluation: A Practical Workshop for Managers and Commissioners </a> Andrew Booth 2014-07-23T08:03:24+01:00 2014-07-23T08:03:24+01:00 Evidence Synthesis of Qualitative Research in Europe (ESQUIRE) 2014 - Booking deadline approaching https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;a2221844.1407 Evidence Synthesis of Qualitative Research in Europe (ESQUIRE) 2014<br><br>*3 Day Course: Tuesday, 2nd to Thursday, 4th September 2014<br>To register: http://www.shef.ac.uk/scharr/shortcourseunit/esquire<br>We advise you make your booking before Friday 15th August 2014.<br>*<br><br>The course will follow the systematic review process as it applies, and<br>is adapted to, qualitative evidence syntheses. The Programme Faculty<br>will take participants through the stages of defining and exploring<br>scope, conducting the literature searches, quality assessing studies for<br>inclusion, synthesising data and writing up and presenting the product<br>of the synthesis. Participants will be provided with practical<br>experience of key stages in the review [...] Hoddinott, Pat 2014-07-06T18:35:45+00:00 2014-07-06T18:35:45+00:00 Re: Recent Methodology Work of Relevance to the ASQUS List https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;6b18da8e.1407 Dear Andrew<br><br>Please could thee alerts be sent to my new email address ;<br><br>p.m.hoddinott@stir.ac.uk<mailto:p.m.hoddinott@stir.ac.uk><br><br>Many thanks<br><br>Pat<br><br>Pat Hoddinott<br>Chair in Primary Care<br>Nursing, Midwifery and Allied Health Professionals Research Unit<br>University of Stirling<br>Stirling FK9 4LA<br>Tel: 01786 466 394 or 341<br>E mail: p.m.hoddinott@stir.ac.uk Andrew Booth 2014-07-02T12:37:51+01:00 2014-07-02T12:37:51+01:00 Recent Methodology Work of Relevance to the ASQUS List https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;19fadf87.1407 BMC Med Res Methodol. <http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24951054#>2014<br>Jun 21;14(1):80. [Epub ahead of print]<br><br>Meta-ethnography25 years on: challenges and insights for synthesising<br>a large number of qualitative studies.<br><br>Toye F<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=Toye%20F%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=24951054>,Seers<br>K<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=Seers%20K%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=24951054>,Allcock<br>N<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=Allcock%20N%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=24951054>,Briggs<br>M<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=Briggs%20M%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=24951054>,Carr<br>E<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=Carr%20E%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=24951054>,Barker<br>K<br><http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?term=Barker%20K%5BAuthor%5D&cauthor=true&cauthor_uid=24951054>.<br><br>Abstract<br><br>Studies that systematically search for and synthesise qualitative<br>research are becoming more evident in health care, and they can make an<br>important contribution to patient care. Our team was funded to complete<br>ameta-ethnographyof patients' experience of chronic musculoskeletal<br>pain. It has been 25 years since Noblit and Hare published their core<br>text onmeta-ethnography, and the current health research environment<br>brings additional [...] Ruth Garside 2014-06-17T16:40:12+01:00 2014-06-17T16:40:12+01:00 PhD studentships at Exeter Medical School https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;c9987d2a.1406 University of Exeter Medical School have several funded PhDs on offer:<br><br>http://www.exeter.ac.uk/studying/funding/award/index.php?id=1506<br><br>One possible project is about using meta-study for synthesis of qualitative research<br>(If you contact UEMS-GraduateResearch@ex.ac.uk for further details, this project outlined on page 10)<br><br>Interested?<br>You can contact me at r.garside@ex.ac.uk for an informal chat about this project.<br><br>best wishes<br><br>Ruth Andrew Booth 2014-04-11T13:04:45+01:00 2014-04-11T13:04:45+01:00 Fwd: [scharr-staff] ScHARR - Upcoming Short Courses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASQUS;758bed6f.1404 The following Systematic Reviews Courses, and the primary course on<br>Complex Interventions, from the SCHARR Short Course Portfolio may<br>particularly be of interest to list members:<br><br>-------- Original Message --------<br>Subject: [scharr-staff] ScHARR - Upcoming Short Courses<br>Date: Fri, 11 Apr 2014 10:06:35 +0100<br>From: ScHARR SCU <scharr-scu@sheffield.ac.uk><br>Reply-To: scharr-scu@sheffield.ac.uk<br>Organisation: University of Sheffield<br>To: scharr-staff@lists.shef.ac.uk<br><br>Dear Colleague<br><br>Please find below details of upcoming Short Courses being delivered by<br>ScHARR, that may be of interest to you. [...]
